common_questions: Tell me about a time you had to do X,Y,Z and how did you do it?
when do you think you can start?
to print every permutation of 'abcd' or some sorting problem?
Tell me about a time when someone did something and there was a conflict how did you handle i
explain everything, I even tried to call (who does that anymore?
describe, but you can tell they are not trying to make you comfortable like a normal hum
describe the job in the most high-stakes terms
interview_tips: to go to one that is near a tech hub
to join the computer science clubs
work experience as an intern as well
that if someone does a search for you they don't find a bunch of personal stuff that could turn them off
you don't cheat which also means you have to do the whole thing in one sitting
for me? I'm doing the phone and technical online interview next week
red_flags: know exactly what they will ask, so your best bet is to learn what is most likely to be asked
asked any questions about my grades or GPA - however I was constantly asked about my experiences with extra curricular programming projects
forget to join the computer science clubs
want this post to come off as "Projects > Internships"
heard of that are outsourcing *because they have to*
US supply salaries, but because no one thinks to apply
know if EVERY state has these nonprofits, but I just looked up a few in a few major states

process_insights.format: Mix of phone screen, technical, behavioral, on-site, virtual
